note.p: Education: Queenwood College, Hampshire. University of Halle; University of Heidelberg; University of Berlin. DSc (London)

Career: Studied abroad (1863-1867); returned to England (1867); Assistant, Mineralogical Department, British Museum; Examiner in Chemistry and Physics, Royal Military Academy, Woolwich; Assistant Examiner in Chemistry, University of London; member, Luminous Meteor Committee, British Association for the Advancement of Science; resigned due to illness
